mods.abstract: Ranaway, FROM Hannibal Faulk, three negro men, as represented by him to me, and I have agreed to take said negroes back as they run, and therefore offer a liberal reward for the arrest and delivery of said negroes in any jail so that I can get them-said Negroes escaped on Sunday night, 8th inst. Isaac, 23 years of age, heavy set, weighs about 185 pounds. Henry, light complexion, 23 years of age, littel finger on left hand drawn from a rising in his hand. Alfred, 28 years of age, dark complexion, weighs about 165 pounds.-Notice of the taking up of said negroes to be given to the Ouachita Register. G. P. DORRIS. Monroe Jan. 12, 1860. tf.
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
